question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/funder/mint.rs] [Function: MintFunder::get_amount()] [Min calculation error] At line 546, std::cmp::min could overflow if both values are near u64::MAX. Can this cause incorrect amount calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/funder/mint.rs] [Function: MintFunder::get_api_client()] [Header injection] Can additional_headers at line 347-351 be manipulated to inject malicious HTTP headers that compromise API security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/funder/mint.rs] [Struct: EntryFunctionId] [Deserialization attack] Can malicious JSON/TOML configs inject arbitrary module addresses via EntryFunctionId at line 40-48 to call privileged Move functions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/funder/transfer.rs] [Function: TransferFunder::fund()] [Health check TOCTOU] Is there a time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerability between is_healthy_as_result at line 275 and actual transaction execution at line 314-320? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/funder/transfer.rs] [Function: TransferFunder::get_amount()] [Bypass parameter ignored] At line 338, did_bypass_checkers is ignored for TransferFunder. Can this create security inconsistencies compared to MintFunder behavior? (Low)
